article.headline: Massachusetts 56, Boston U. 54
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- Rashaun Freeman scored 14 of his 20 points in the second half as Massachusetts held off a furious Boston University comeback Wednesday night for a 56-54 victory. UMass (7-2) led, 56-46, with 4:40 left and then didn't score again. The Terriers (3-5) had the ball with 20 seconds remaining and Carlos Strong missed a 3-point shot. There was a scramble for the rebound as time ran out. Freeman also had 12 rebounds. Stephane Lasme added 12 points, five rebounds and five blocked shots and Brandon Thomas added 10 points for the Minutemen. UMass won the game despite turning the ball over 22 times, including six turnovers by Freeman. Freshman Corey Lowe led BU with 16 points and seven rebounds, while Brian Macon had 13 points and three steals. The win was the ninth straight for UMass over BU, which hasn't beaten the Minutemen since Dec. 4, 1986.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
